question.text: The chemiosmotic hypothesis suggests that the ATP are produced on the inner membrane of mitochondria due to:

options.text: F<sub>1</sub> particles present between the inner and outer membrane of mitochondria.
Involvement of oxygen as the electron acceptor.
Creation of a proton electrochemical gradient across inner membrane of mitochondria.
Enzymes present in the mitochondrial matrix.

solution.text: The chemiosmotic hypothesis put forth by Sir Peter Mitchell suggests that the proton gradient created across the inner membrane of mitochondria is responsible for the pumping of <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> ions into the mitochondrial matrix. This energy produced by the proton pump is harnessed by the catalytic subunit of ATPase enzyme complex to produce ATP. A similar mechanism is seen in the thylakoid membrane of chloroplast during energy production in the light reaction of photosynthesis.
